name: timber_strength
title: AS 1720.1 Timber Beam Design Capacity Calculator
description: Australian Standards timber beam design bending moment capacity calculation (Md) with all modification factors

beam_width.description: Cross-sectional width of the timber beam in millimeters

beam_depth.description: Cross-sectional depth of the timber beam in millimeters

f_b_prime.description: Characteristic bending strength for the timber grade

load_duration.description: Design load duration in years (0 for 5 seconds, 0.014 for 5 days, 0.42 for 5 months, 50 for permanent)
load_duration.clause: Table G1 - Duration of load factor k1

k4_factor.description: Partial seasoning factor for moisture content effects

k6_factor.description: Temperature factor for elevated temperature conditions

k9_factor.description: Strength sharing factor for parallel member systems

k12_stability.clause: Clause 3.2.3 - Member subjected to bending, k12 stability factor

applied_moment.description: Design bending moment M* applied to the beam

section_modulus.description: Section modulus Z = bd²/6 for rectangular sections

capacity_factor.description: Capacity factor φ based on application category

k1_duration.clause: Table G1 (Appendix G) - Duration factor k1

design_capacity_md.description: Design moment capacity Md = φ × k1 × k4 × k6 × k9 × k12 × f'b × Z

utilization_ratio.description: Ratio of applied moment to design capacity (M*/Md)

beam_classification.description: Assessment result: ADEQUATE if utilization ≤ 1.0, INADEQUATE if > 1.0
